intro: Struthanthus apiculatus, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Struthanthus apiculatus is also known for its ability to regenerate after fires, making it an important component of its desert ecosystem.
